title._content: ["Millefiori," Albert Barnes Boardman house, Great Plains Road and Coopers Neck Lane, Southampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Millefiori," Albert Barnes Boardman house, Great Plains Road and Coopers Neck Lane, Southampton, New York. Garden gate] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Site History. House Architecture: Hill & Stout, 1910. Landscape: Marian Cruger Coffin, 1910. Associated Name: Georgina Gertrude Bonner (Mrs. Albert B.) Boardman. Other: Also known as "Villa Mille Fiori." Today: House and garden not extant. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 70. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16188 Call Number: LC-J717-X99- 30
